episodes.title: Ep. 71: Lit Recs: Poverty Awareness Month
episodes.description: Join Amanda and Kelsey as they explore books that highlight themes of poverty, resilience, and systemic inequalities. From personal memoirs to stories of activism and struggle, they delve into narratives that reveal the harsh realities faced by many. Make sure to share with us your own recs for Poverty Awareness Month! 00:00 Welcome to Lit Vibes 00:21 Follow Us on Social Media 02:35 Our Current Reads 06:59 All About Poverty Awareness Month 08:51 Heir by Sabaa Tahir 16:54 Finding Me by Viola Davis 24:02 Making a Difference: My Fight for Native Rights by Ada Deer 31:51 The Sound of Gravel by Ruth Wariner 38:13 Conclusion and Social Media Plugs Send us a text Follow us on TikTok & Youtube @litvibesonlypodcast and on Instagram @litvibesonly_podcast. You can also email us at litvibesonlypodcast@gmail.com We'd love to hear from you! See you on Mondays!
subjects: Church of the First Born of the Lamb of God
